current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To allow States to let Federal funds for the education of disadvantaged children follow low-income
			 children to the accredited or otherwise State-approved public school,
			 private school, or supplemental educational services program they attend.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Scholarships for Kids Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

The purpose of this Act is to improve the academic achievement of the disadvantaged by encouraging
			 State efforts to expand the educational choices available to low-income
			 students.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

make a grant available on behalf of  each eligible child, in the amount determined under such
			 subparagraph, that the parents of the eligible child may use for any of
			 the following purposes, as allowed by State law:
To supplement the budget of any public school the eligible child is able to attend without fees.

To pay for all, or a portion,  of any fees required to attend another public school in the
			 participating State.

To pay for all, or a portion, of the tuition and fees required to attend an accredited or otherwise
			 State-approved private school.

To pay for all, or  a portion, of the fees required to participate in a State-approved supplemental
			 educational services program.
